meanings.definition: Arrange a new mortgage for (a property).
meanings.sent1: She remortgages her house to get a better deal on her loan.
meanings.sent2: He often remortgages his property to take advantage of lower interest rates.
meanings.sent3: The house decided to remortgage itself for a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: Remortgaging the property was like giving it a financial makeover.
meanings.sent5: Remortgages can help homeowners save money in the long run.

meanings.definition: The action of arranging a new mortgage for (a property).
meanings.sent1: The remortgages of many homes increased due to the economic changes.
meanings.sent2: She works in the finance industry and specializes in remortgages.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood had a party to celebrate all the recent remortgages.
meanings.sent4: The rise in remortgages signaled a shift in the housing market.
meanings.sent5: Remortgages are common when interest rates drop significantly.
